summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing scheduling and coordination regarding the Epstein investigation, specifically mentioning a conference with Epstein before Berman and topics of forfeiture and RICO.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of a conference and investigation; the email asks 'Who is Epstein?' indicating the recipient may not be fully briefed.

persons.name: Berman
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of an Epstein conference scheduled before him, indicating his oversight or involvement in the case.

events.title: Email discussion on Epstein investigation
events.description: Email exchange among prosecutors coordinating on the Epstein case, discussing scheduling a conference and investigation topics like forfeiture and RICO.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 27, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It references an 'Epstein conference before Berman', indicating ongoing legal proceedings or discussions involving the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The topics of 'forfeiture and rico' are mentioned, suggesting the investigation was considering asset forfeiture and RICO charges.
The tone suggests coordination and possible confusion ('Who is Epstein?') among team members regarding the case.
